channel.title: Crazy Idea../Lock Please
channel.description:
I just had this crazy idea, what if [b]Moparscape[/b] had it's own RSPS? That would be awesome.. And we use the Mopar client to play. I know it sounds crazy, but imagine that :eek:
/Mod Lock Please

Arcik is also good, but your wording (“advanced coding”) made me lol at how derpy it is.
Anyway, start looking for devs if srs[/quote]
It’s not going to happen lol. We all wish it would but as Thorak said in the other thread there is no reason to do it other than the reason “it would be cool”

item.title: Crazy Idea../Lock Please
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:43, topic:509242”][quote author=ox random xi link=topic=627484.msg4264470#msg4264470 date=1363861476]

Ruby = Website Coding Ox Random Xi = Coding Arcik = Advanced Coding

Just seen this lol. I didn’t know random could program and arcik certainly isn’t advanced, why not use a team of java gurus?

The funny thing is I can’t… lol. I’m more of a community manager and a creative writer… haha

Been thought of by many before you. Never gets started, always to disorganized. You can’t create such a server without some degree of corruption running about, as it would be so large scale. Plus, MITB doesnt need to worry about that. He already makes a over a grand from the sponsored servers every month.
[/quote]loloveragrand
probably like 5k+ due to the bids going into the multi-hundreds

It averages around 2000$ per month by the looks of things on the bidding page in recent months. Then he has Adsense on top of that from 5 sites. Money isn’t the object here though, money has never been a part of moparscape before and this aspect wouldn’t and shouldn’t matter either.

No one can’t agree to have a good RSPS money isn’t a key part.

That’s the problem with most servers these days, they take money as a key part, it isn’t and shouldn’t be. If there’s enough for hosting costs which would be covered by advertisements and SSP gold spots so money really wouldn’t be an option, if the developers worked for free that is.[/quote]
And how do you plan on covering those cost though? Money is a part and as said above, I don’t think Java Gurus work for fee.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

A crazy idea just came to me, why not use the superior programming language, Erlang. We could create a distributed server that could scale up on just about any machine then we could use the Java interface to create the content!

item.title: Crazy Idea../Lock Please
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

It has been mentioned many times, and it has been considered in previous times. There just aren’t too many reasons for having an official one, mostly due to many private servers dying or being shut down. Even if an official server was to come along, what revision would it be based upon? I’m sure it would take much longer than a few days, maybe even months.

Read full topic

item.title: Crazy Idea../Lock Please
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Jmood:

Trying to manage a community is very difficult when you have a very diverse pool of members, trying to please everyone will just ruin everything. If you have some suggestions bring them up to the administration or even moderators, we also have the irc for a reason… As for the server it will be very hard to do, everyone has ideas on how to implement features and design the server that it will sooner or later get dead locked, hell even hybridscape got dropped out. Over at MITB they tried to do the same thing and failed. the problem we have is we don’t have the dedicated team we would need to achieve such a goal.

Exactly this, its requires a good, dedicated team to even make something great. My chatroom is at a deadhault until I can get some people to help me with my tasks, as its getting to be to much to handle. The problem is there are a select few that I would even allow to touch my chatroom because not many people even know how to build efficient code, rather than just build something that ‘works’ but is a hog on the cycles.

I’ve seen it before when I was on a RSPS dev team. I had to re-write the entire smithing and minning class someone made because it was so inificient that it actually slowed the server about 30%. There are just not enough people with enough time and skills to do something like this. Especially with no financial gain. Its hard to keep doing something that you get nothing for, as real life and bills can easily get in the way.

Read full topic
